page.title: 01PARISH OF HINGHAM, NORFOLK
page.content: The flat arable landscape is broken by a shallow west to east valley running down to Seamere. Away from the town many fields are very large. Boundaries are often only ditches. There are few woods or individual trees. The small town (population 1900) lies on higher ground to the north and has a centre of old, many Georgian, houses around two greens and a large fourteenth-century church, with modern development including a Council and five private estates round the periphery. East is an industrial estate with a large factory making metal farm buildings. Northwest is Hall Farm, a frozen poultry concern. Many people work in Norwich, Wymondham etc. Near the Fairland are Legion, Youth and Bowls clubs, village hall and library. The new sportfield lies in Watton Road. The playspace is near
